pr_title: ISPN-12177 Persist IRAC version during shutdown

timeline.message: ISPN-12177 Persist IRAC version during shutdown
ISPN-12177 Persist IRAC version during shutdown
ISPN-12177 Persist IRAC version during shutdown

timeline.bodyText: Looks like topologyId can be removed as well?
timeline.author: wburns
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +92,7 @@ public String toString() {
             "cacheName=" + cacheName +
             ", segment=" + segment +
             ", topologyId=" + topologyId +

replies.bodyText: not really. It makes sure the node has at least that topology installed before handling the executing the command.
replies.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: Shouldn't it be part of the readFrom and writeTo though?
replies.author: wburns

replies.bodyText:
no, the previous code was incorrect.
The CacheRpcCommandExternalizer [1] invokes the ReplicableCommandExternalizer [2] and the latter sends the topology id.
[1] https://github.com/infinispan/infinispan/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/infinispan/marshall/exts/CacheRpcCommandExternalizer.java#L142
[2] https://github.com/infinispan/infinispan/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/infinispan/marshall/exts/ReplicableCommandExternalizer.java#L82
replies.author: pruivo

timeline.bodyText: This seems awfully expensive to compile a new Pattern on every invocation. I would suggest to store the compiled pattern statically.
timeline.author: wburns

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason this was changed? The prior appending is much faster and a bit easier to read imo.
timeline.author: wburns

replies.bodyText: I've spent too much time in python xD
replies.author: pruivo

timeline.author: wburns
